roleset.name: fasten
roleset.note: LATCH-V NOTES: Frames file for 'latch' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from latch.01-v predicate notes)

role.descr: thing(s) being latched (each gets its own arg1)

example.name: transitive with Arg-MNR
example.text: But as advertisers latch onto disasters with increasing frequency , they risk [*-1] hurting themselves as much as [*-1]helping the cause .

example.name: arg1 as subject
example.text: It latches when you close it , so stay as long as you like '' .

example.name: multiple arg1s
example.text: He latched the gate to her stall and gave her an affectionate rub on her soft snout

example.name: transitive
example.text: For , just as Mr. Giuliani latches on to an issue that [*T*-1] has Mr. Dinkins reeling , his campaign desperately needs cash [*]to keep Mr. Ailes 's commercials on the air beyond Wednesday or Thursday .
example.arg: to an issue that [*T*-1] has Mr. Dinkins reeling
